912979347459444736.text: 14/ Most excitingly there is @Oceanprotocol. An exchange protocol to connect data-haves and data-needs: https://blog.oceanprotocol.com/from-ai-to-blockchain-to-data-meet-ocean-f210ff460465 …

912979182627549184.text: 13/ And with the help of @IPDBFoundation, we opened up the test network to the general public. Sign up here: https://developers.ipdb.io

912979010438799360.text: 11/ We released https://github.com/bigchaindb/privacy-protocols … a way to share private information on public ledgers.

912978897033101312.text: 10/ We introduced a new set of basic operations for data stores: CRAB. Check this awesome tutorial: https://tutorials.bigchaindb.com/crab/ pic.twitter.com/NPip5Xv9Ps

912978493973164032.text:
9/ Thanks to @Authenteq and @nileshtrivedi, We now have:

- Java: https://github.com/authenteq/java-bigchaindb-driver … and
- Ruby: https://github.com/nileshtrivedi/bigchaindb-ruby-client …

drivers!

912978419767529472.text: 8/ Finally, our community has shipped some super cool tools and protocols:

912978347252207617.text: 7/ We also released BigchainDB 1.1, including a plugable Events API, updated deployments and secure WebSockets:https://github.com/bigchaindb/bigchaindb/releases/tag/v1.1.0 …

912978160152702976.text: 6/ (4) Improvements to BigchainDB's federated consensus to make joining the network and adding/removing nodes easier.

912978106411085825.text: 5/ (3) Multiple per-asset consensus processes in a single BDB cluster. Asset exchange through state channel protocols like @Interledger.

912978013972844544.text: 4/ (2) Data models that allow us to scale BigchainDB linearly. We're thinking: Sparse Merkle trees for asset-based sharing.

912977940773826560.text: 3/ (1) Improving the security of BigchainDB's data replication by changing its network topology.
